trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a simple repository of user names and passwords using the BUILTIN authentication mechanism.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a simple repository of user names and passwords using the BUILTIN authentication mechanism.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a simple repository of user names and passwords using the BUILTIN authentication mechanism.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases. It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication. It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

trans-unit.source: To use the BUILTIN repository, set <codeph>derby.authentication.provider</codeph> to <codeph>BUILTIN</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: To use the BUILTIN repository, set <codeph>derby.authentication.provider</codeph> to <codeph>BUILTIN</codeph>.

target.mrk: To use the BUILTIN repository, set <codeph>derby.authentication.provider</codeph> to <codeph>BUILTIN</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: You can create user names and passwords for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> users by specifying them with the <codeph>derby.user.UserName</codeph> property.

seg-source.mrk: You can create user names and passwords for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> users by specifying them with the <codeph>derby.user.UserName</codeph> property.

target.mrk: You can create user names and passwords for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> users by specifying them with the <codeph>derby.user.UserName</codeph> property.

trans-unit.source: These user names are case-sensitive for user authentication. User names are SQL92Identifiers. Delimited identifiers are allowed:

seg-source.mrk: These user names are case-sensitive for user authentication.

target.mrk: These user names are case-sensitive for user authentication.

trans-unit.source: For passwords, it is a good idea not to use words that would be easily guessed, such as a login name or simple words or numbers. A password should be a mix of numbers and upper- and lowercase letters.

seg-source.mrk: For passwords, it is a good idea not to use words that would be easily guessed, such as a login name or simple words or numbers.
A password should be a mix of numbers and upper- and lowercase letters.

target.mrk: For passwords, it is a good idea not to use words that would be easily guessed, such as a login name or simple words or numbers.
A password should be a mix of numbers and upper- and lowercase letters.
